content: Yes, being a lady-in-waiting was a very demanding job, but it also had some perks. One of the most significant benefits of being a lady-in-waiting was the opportunity to be close to the queen or princess and participate in court life. Lady-in-waitings had access to exclusive events, parties, and other courtly functions which were not open to the general public. They were also provided with clothing, food, and shelter by the queen or princess they served, at no cost to them. A lady-in-waiting could use this position as a stepping stone for marrying into a noble family or finding a suitable husband for herself. In addition, being a lady-in-waiting could provide the chance to travel with the queen or princess to other countries, giving a unique opportunity to see new places and meet interesting people. Overall, the perks of being a lady-in-waiting mainly came from the prestige and honor associated with the position and the possibility of advancing one's social status.
